initial_question.title: Ctrl-C kills VSCode if started from command prompt
initial_question.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary Update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. From the command prompt, run "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe". 
2. Press Ctrl-C from command prompt, VSCode exits immediately

satisfaction_conditions: VSCode must remain running when Ctrl-C is pressed in the parent command prompt
VSCode must be launched in a way that isolates it from the parent command prompt's control signals
The launch method must work from a command prompt on Windows 10

initial_question.title: [loc][Query][DevDiv] Translatability of Code
initial_question.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please?

Source:
Please restart Code before reinstalling {0}.

File Name:
src\vs\platform\extensionManagement\node\extensionManagementService.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "restartCode"

Query:
Is Code translatable?   Cristina Carrasco   6/9/2016 9:18:45 AM

satisfaction_conditions: The localization status must be clearly indicated
A path forward must be provided if translation is needed
